--- title: "Spider web top" description: "a cool top for halloween or any time you're feeling spooky" author: - name: Katelyn Vidal url: https://katelyn-vidal.github.io/ date: 06-13-2024 categories: [Tops] # self-defined categories citation: url: https://katelyn-vidal.github.io/posts/2024-06-13-crochet-web-blog-post/ image: spiderweb_copy.png draft: false --- ![](spiderweb.png){fig-align="center" width="356"} # Description This top is great for beginners and builds up super quickly too, making this a great last-minute Halloween outfit! # Materials 4.25mm crochet hook (I used a slightly larger hook for looser stitches)\ Superfine-fine yarn (any thin yarn works)\ Stitch markers (safety pins, paper clips, or bobby pins work great)\ Darning needle\ Scissors\ Measuring tape\ Patience # Tutorial Here's the youtube tutorial I followed to make this top! ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: ::: # Tips I highly recommend using stitch markers to keep track of your rows because it can get a bit tricky as you go. Also, the video tutorial includes sleeves, but if you want to recreate the top like how I made it, just skip that part!
